instruction: Create a Deep Neural Network in Python that classifies if a credit card transaction is fraudulent or not.
buggy_code:
import numpy as np from keras.models import Sequential from keras.layers import Dense,Dropout from keras.wrappers.scikit_learn import KerasClassifier from keras.optimizers import Adam from sklearn.model_selection import train_test_split def build_model(input_dim): return model = Sequential() model.add(Dense(64,input_dim=input_dim, activation='relu')) model.add(Dropout(0.4)) model.add(Dense(32, activation='relu')) model.add(Dropout(0.4)) model.add(Dense(2, activation='softmax')) model.compile(loss='categorical_crossentropy', optimizer=Adam(lr=0.001), metrics=['accuracy']) return model X = np.load("x_data.npy") y = np.load("y_data.npy") X_train, X_test, y_train, y_test = train_test_split(X, y, test_size=0.2) input_dim = X_train.shape[1] model = KerasClassifier(build_fn=lambda: build_model(input_dim)) model.fit(X_train, y_train, epochs=22, batch_size=32, verbose=1) accuracy = model.score(X_test, y_test) print("Accuracy: ", accuracy) 6.
